item.title: Week 10: Pivotal weekend for CFB playoff's rankings
item.description: The crew discuss this weekend's huge matchups. The biggest matchups comes from the SEC with a battle between #1 Tennessee vs #3 Georgia, and #6 Alabama vs #10 LSU. Also, with the playoffs around the corner can we potentially see Ohio State or Michigan make it in with a loss? Another thing worth noting is who is the front runner for the Heisman award? item.title: Top Dogs: Battle of the Undefeated
item.description: The crew looks into this weekend's upcoming matchups, headlined by an undefeated Tennessee against an undefeated Georgia. Additionally, Alabama and LSU face off in a Death Valley showdown. Next, Wendi takes a look at the Wendy's Weekend Wakeup, focusing on notable HBCU matchups, including Howard vs North Carolina Central, and Southern vs Florida A&M. Finally, Wendi, Sam and Steve give their predictions for week 10 on "What a Weekend It Would Be." Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Who's too high? Who's too low? Breaking down the College Playoff Rankings plus Sonny Dykes and a Class of 2024 Commitment
item.description: The crew looks into the College Football Playoff initial rankings, discussing who missed out and who made it to the 4 playoff spots, who was disrespected and who was overrated, and the three first-time-ranked teams. Additionally, the crew touches on the four Michigan State players who were suspended for their involvement in the tunnel altercation with Michigan this past weekend. Uncommitted Class of 2024 dual-threat quarterback Julian Sayin joins the show live for decision between LSU, Georgia, and Alabama. Then, Sonny Dykes then joins to discuss TCU's undefeated season and their number 7 CFP ranking. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: One State, One Tunnel: Recap and Fallout of an Eventful Week 9
item.description: Today, hosts Wendi Nix, Desmond Howard, and Greg McElroy react to the fallout of a wide range of stories, notably the Michigan-Michigan State tunnel brawl that occurred post game and the firing of Auburn coach Bryan Harsin. In addition, the crew, with guest Heather Dinich, looks into the upcoming CFP rankings that will come out later tonight and how last weekends games could have shaken things up for the committee. In particular, could Clemson be left out, could TCU sneak above Alabama, and more. We finish the segment with guest Chris Low on Bryan Harsin's tumultuous two seasons at Auburn and what that means for both Harsin and Auburn. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: A Look Ahead into Week 9
item.description: Today our hosts Wendi Nix, David Pollack, and Roddy Jones are joined by UNC head coach Mack Brown. The group discuss UNC's upcoming matchup versus Pittsburgh and what that means for the ACC Coastal. The crew then discusses the Ohio State at Penn State matchup, looking back at the close games between the two in the last 8 years, as well as games with playoff implications and Illinois's chances to win the Big 10 West. We finish with a discussion about Texas's woes this season. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Reacting to the Biggest Stories from Week 8
item.description: Today our hosts Wendi Nix, Sam Acho, and Greg McElroy are joined by David Hale and Bill Connelly to react and report on the most important stories from the past weekend. The crew discusses Clemson's quarterback situation and what their playoff chances are truly looking like considering their schedule. They also provide their takeaways from the LSU v Ole Miss matchup, who are having a midseason resurgence after a shaky start. Additionally, the crew looks into Mike Leach's interesting dinosaur remarks and Lane Kiffin's reaction. They rank the six undefeated teams left and take a quick look into next weeks matchups such as Penn State v Ohio State, and Georgia v Florida. We finish with a throwback story and interview with Mark Schlabaugh about his misbehaving, field-streaking dog -- Tubby. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: Live from Eugene, Oregon, previewing Top Matchups for Week 8
item.description: Live from Eugene, Oregon, Jen Lada, David Pollack and Desmond Howard dive into the Week 8 ranked CFB matchups. They take deep looks Oregon vs UCLA, Syracuse vs Clemson, and Kansas State vs TCU. Additionally, they discuss OSU's quarterback Spencer Sander's status for this week's matchup vs Texas, as well as a look into Oregon's tight end who passed this summer, Spencer Webb. Alabama's bounce back matchup vs Mississippi State is also discussed. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

item.title: The Best of the PAC12 and a Visit from a 4 time Super Bowl Champion
item.description: Wendi Nix, Eddie Royal and Stanford Steve discuss if Clemson is officially back and who has the best chance to win ACC Coastal. Then, Pete Thamel joins the show to tell us which Big12 quarterback will return to the field after missing the past month due to an injury and which SEC quarterback is questionable for Saturday. Also, who's leading the PAC 12 and how does Utah plan to put a stop to UCLA's undefeated season? Plus, four time Super Bowl Champion and three time Super Bowl MVP, Joe Montana, stops by to give his thoughts on Notre Dame this season and remembers the 1979 Cotton Bowl. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
